block.p: Nadia Ahmed Nagib and Christian Downing Wallace were married yesterday in the garden of Fernbrook, an 18th-century estate, in Bordentown, N.J. Judge Anne E. Thompson, the chief judge of the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey, officiated.

The bride, 33, is a volunteer litigator with the Brennan Center for Justice, a public interest law organization at New York University. Until June, she was an associate specializing in commercial litigation at Jenner & Block, a Chicago law firm. She graduated from Mount Holyoke College and received a law degree from the University of Illinois at Champaign-Urbana.

Nadia Ahmed Nagib and Christian Downing Wallace were married yesterday in the garden of Fernbrook, an 18th-century estate, in Bordentown, N.J. Judge Anne E. Thompson, the chief judge of the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey, officiated.

The bride, 33, is a volunteer litigator with the Brennan Center for Justice, a public interest law organization at New York University. Until June, she was an associate specializing in commercial litigation at Jenner & Block, a Chicago law firm. She graduated from Mount Holyoke College and received a law degree from the University of Illinois at Champaign-Urbana.

She is a daughter of Judith Nagib, who was until recently a mental health specialist with Cermak Health Services, working at the Cook County Jail in Chicago, and Dr. Ahmed Nagib, a neurosurgeon in Cairo, Egypt. The bride's father had practiced at McHenry Hospital in McHenry, Ill., until 1989.

Mr. Wallace, 38, graduated magna cum laude from Princeton University and received an M.B.A. from Stanford University. He is an assistant and investment adviser to the chairman of the Joint Board of the Electrical Industry, a nonprofit organization in Flushing, Queens, that manages benefit plans for unionized electrical industry workers. He is also on the board of directors of the Community Capital Bank in Brooklyn.

Mr. Wallace is the son of Marjorie Goebel Wallace and John Wallace of Princeton, N.J. The bridegroom's father is a former mayor of Princeton Township, N.J., who retired as the chairman and chief executive of CoreStates New Jersey National Bank in Ewing Township, N.J.
